summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting the interview of a former assistant to Ghislaine Maxwell, conducted on October 28, 2020. The witness, who worked for Jeffrey Epstein and Maxwell from approximately 1996 to 2002, describes her role, office operations, travel logistics, and her impressions of Epstein and Maxwell. She provides details about other staff members and the general atmosphere of the workplace.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary employer of the witness. Described as casual, not personable, and involved in purchasing and developing properties, including an island. He donated to charities and arts institutions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The witness's direct supervisor. Described as charismatic, demanding, and initially in a romantic relationship with Epstein. She managed properties and office operations at 457 Madison Avenue.

persons.name: Tamara Giwa
persons.context: Attorney present for the witness's interview with law enforcement.

persons.name: Jeff Schantz
persons.context: The person the witness reported to for the first six months of her employment.

persons.name: Miriam
persons.context: A French assistant to Ghislaine Maxwell who called in sick one day, leading the witness to temporarily fill in.

persons.name: Rich Barnett
persons.context: Met by the witness at Epstein's 71st Street house.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Epstein's pilot who would communicate 'wheels up' times to the witness so she could coordinate with the driver.

persons.name: Jojo
persons.context: Epstein's driver. The witness would relay pick-up times from the pilot to him.

persons.name: Girlie
persons.context: A maid, wife of a driver, who handled house stuff.

persons.name: Michelle Healy
persons.context: Epstein's receptionist when the witness first started working.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: An assistant to Jeffrey Epstein. The witness could not recall her last name.

persons.name: Sue Ann
persons.context: An assistant to Jeffrey Epstein. The witness could not recall her last name.

persons.name: Lesley Groff
persons.context: Epstein's assistant when the witness left. They were friends and socialized outside the office. Her role was to connect Epstein to people and handle messages.

persons.name: Adam Perry Lang
persons.context: A chef hired by Epstein. The witness was present when he was hired.

persons.name: Ted Waitt
persons.context: A man Ghislaine Maxwell was dating around 2007/2008. The witness interviewed for a job with him.

connections.description: The witness states that at one point Epstein and Maxwell were a couple, arriving together and acting like a couple in the office.
Maxwell was the witness's direct supervisor and office manager. The witness served as her permanent assistant.
Epstein was the witness's ultimate employer. She worked for his companies for six years.
They were friends who socialized outside the office and talked about personal lives.
The witness states Maxwell was dating Waitt around 2007/2008 and interviewed the witness for a job with him.

events.title: Witness begins employment
events.description: The witness, approximately 28 years old, moves to New York and is hired through an employment agency to work for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Witness leaves employment
events.description: The witness leaves her job with Epstein and Maxwell to return to California, sometime after 9/11 and around summer 2002.

events.title: Witness visits office
events.description: The witness returns to visit the office and does some work for extra cash, paid in cash.

events.title: Job interview with Maxwell
events.description: The witness interviews in California for a project manager position with Ted Waitt, who Maxwell was dating at the time. She does not get the job.

events.title: FBI Interview
events.description: The witness is interviewed over video conference by federal prosecutors, a detective, and an FBI Special Agent regarding her employment with Epstein and Maxwell.

locations: 457 Madison Avenue, New York, New York (Epstein/Maxwell office)
71st Street house, New York, New York (Epstein property)
65th Street townhouse, New York, New York (Maxwell's home)
Epstein's private island (referred to as 'the island')
keyFacts: The witness worked as an executive/personal assistant for Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein from approximately 1996 to 2002.
She confirms Epstein and Maxwell were in a romantic relationship during her employment and describes Maxwell's role as office and estate manager.
The witness signed a non-disclosure agreement prohibiting her from speaking to the media or press, though she does not recall who presented it.
She details the operational structure, including other staff like assistants, drivers, pilots, and a chef, and describes the fast-paced nature of managing Epstein's multiple properties.
The witness states she never saw anyone in the office who looked younger than herself (she was 28 when she started) and, looking back, did not notice anything odd at the time.
